(a) If there are no two donuts in the bag of the same variety, then it is not possible to choose 6 donuts from 8 varieties as each donut should be of a different variety.

(b) If all donuts in the bag are of the same variety, there are 8 ways, because there are 8 varieties to choose from, and we are choosing one variety.

(c) If there are no restrictions on the contents of the bag, then it is a problem of combinations with repetition. The answer is C(6+8-1, 6) = C(13, 6) = 1716.

(d) If there must be at least two varieties in the bag, we subtract the ways where all the donuts are of the same kind from the total ways. So, 1716 - 8 = 1708.

(e) If there must be at least three blueberry-filled donuts in the bag, we take 3 blueberry-filled donuts and choose the rest from other varieties. So, C(3+7-1,3)*C(3+7-1,3) = 120*120 = 14400.

(f) If there can be no more than two blueberry-filled donuts in the bag, we need to calculate the ways when there are no blueberry-filled donuts, one blueberry-filled donut, and two blueberry-filled donuts and sum them. So, (C(6+7-1,6) + C(5+7-1,5)*8 + C(4+7-1,4)*C(2,1)*8) = 792+3360+2100 = 6252.

(b) If all donuts in the bag are of the same variety: There are 8 ways. You can simply choose one variety out of 8 and fill the bag with it.

(c) If there are no restrictions on the contents of the bag: This is a problem of combinations with repetitions allowed, also known as multiset coefficients or "combinations with replacement". The formula is (n+r-1) choose r, where n is the number of varieties and r is the number of donuts. In this case, it would be (8+6-1) choose 6, which equals 792.

(d) If there must be at least two varieties in the bag: Subtract the number of ways to choose all donuts of the same variety (which is 8, from part b) from the total number of ways without restrictions (which is 792, from part c). This would give you 792 - 8 = 784 ways.

(e) If there must be at least three blueberry-filled donuts in the bag: Choose 3 blueberry-filled donuts first, leaving 3 to be chosen from any of the 8 varieties. This is (8+3-1) choose 3 = 120 ways.

(f) If there can be no more than two blueberry-filled donuts in the bag: Subtract the number of ways to choose with at least three blueberry-filled donuts (which is 120, from part e) from the total number of ways without restrictions (which is 792, from part c). This would give you 792 - 120 = 672 ways.

Plugging these numbers into the formula gives us (8 + 6 - 1) choose 6 = 13 choose 6 = 1716 ways.

(d) If there must be at least two varieties in the bag, we subtract the case where all donuts are of the same variety (8 ways) from the total ways without restrictions (1716 ways). So there would be 1716 - 8 = 1708 ways.

(e) If there must be at least three blueberry-filled donuts in the bag, we can calculate it in three cases: 3 blueberry donuts and 3 other variety, 4 blueberry donuts and 2 other variety, 5 blueberry donuts and 1 other variety, or all 6 are blueberry donuts. (b) If all donuts in the bag are of the same variety, then we are simply choosing one variety from the 8 available. This is also a simple combination and can be calculated as C(8,1) = 8 ways.

(c) If there are no restrictions on the contents of the bag, then this is a problem of combinations with repetition. The formula for this is C(n + r - 1, r), where n is the number of varieties and r is the number of donuts. Plugging in our values, we get C(8 + 6 - 1, 6) = C(13, 6) = 1,716 ways.

(d) If there must be at least two varieties in the bag, we subtract the ways to get all donuts of the same variety from the total number of ways. So, 1,716 - 8 = 1,708 ways.

(e) If there must be at least three blueberry-filled donuts in the bag, we first choose 3 blueberry donuts and then choose the remaining 3 from the remaining 7 varieties. This is calculated as C(7 + 3 - 1, 3) = C(9, 3) = 84 ways.

(f) If there can be no more than two blueberry-filled donuts in the bag, we have three cases: no blueberry donuts, one blueberry donut, and two blueberry donuts. We calculate the ways for each case and then add them together:

- No blueberry: C(7 + 6 - 1, 6) = C(12, 6) = 924 ways
- One blueberry: C(7 + 5 - 1, 5) = C(11, 5) = 462 ways
- Two blueberries: C(7 + 4 - 1, 4) = C(10, 4) = 210 ways

Adding these together, we get 924 + 462 + 210 = 1,596 ways.
